runs.comm: a leg-stump line, and he begins with a wide. 79 needed
beats him with a beauty which holds its line on the off stump. Terrific ball from Anderson
Gayle's away! What a shot! Steps outside leg and utterly hammers it backward of point. Sheer power
banged to mid-off
tight delivery cutting back into the right-handed Fletcher who defends
crunched back to Anderson who fields well with his left hand, transfers to the right and threatens to whack the stumps to remind Fletcher England aren't here party like party people, people
goes for a pull and skies it miles, miles and miles in the air! The catch is safely taken and that's Fletcher's third duck in a row
four! Four! Nothing more than a short-arm jab over midwicket, but it shot like a bullet out of a gun
he's hammered this, too. It reaches mid-off in a split second. Quite incredible how hard he hits it
flayed and scythed over extra cover, and only just over the fielder, for another savage four
steps down the pitch, his bandanna swishing behind his head like a pirate's might, but he gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
full and straight and the crowd erupt - absolutely erupt! A fantastic yorker drills into his middle stump and beats Gayle's drive

but he's beaten by a cracker which holds its line beautifully on the right-hander who drives and misses, and in the background the crowd all jump up in nervous anticipation before, as one, roaring "ooohhhh"
uppercut over the slip down to third man - England have another! Sidebottom at third man steadies himself and takes a good, low catch
lovely shot - worked through midwicket and that fairly races away for four
good slower ball, dropped out to the off side
good, fast bouncer and it's fended off his ribs
a deft, late flick behind square on the leg side. Excellent fielding prevents two
pushed out to the off side. Pollard wants a single which simply isn't there, and Broad lets him know it, the pair colliding...but laughing about it. Good to see.
beaten! Quick ball outside off, he tries to cut and misses. Good take by Foster
another huge swing and miss. West Indies have to realise that this is not a difficult target. They're already panicking and losing their heads
uppishly flicked to leg
goes down on one knee in an attempt to smite it over midwicket but it spins markedly into his pads
very good line and length and it's poked to point
fine, fine shot. It was tossed up outside off and was absolutely in the slot. Pollard took a couple of steps down the pitch, lofting it inside-out over long-off and handsomely for six
six! Six! Smashed inside out over extra cover. Gorgeous, elegant, classical batting
better line and length, nudged to leg
an ugly hack across the line - a real bludgeon
bowled him! What nerve by Rashid - the top-spinner hurried onto Pollard, beating his bull-charge down the pitch, and skidded through to bowl him. Brilliant!
down the pitch and makes it into a full toss, nudging to short fine-leg
nice drift there into the right-hander, before straightening with the spin and it's clipped to leg
down onto one knee and a fumble at deep square leg allows them through for two
outside off, he plays and misses and Foster whips off the bails! Third umpire agrees that his back foot was lifted - what outstanding keeping from Foster, two days in a row!
a wide down the leg side
sharp, prodigious turn and he cuts it out to point where Shah tries to fall on it and, well, parries it for another run. Oh dear. Not the sharpest tool in the field...
flicked to leg
fired in straight, Chanderpaul plucks it out to the off side
cracked over midwicket though he doesn't quite time it
swings in late on the full, bashed to mid-off. They get a single
terrific ball, pitching it right up and they only get a single to mid-off
wide - wide! Very wide of the off stump
ah, shot by Sarwan - superb stroke, stepping outside leg to give himself room and he smites it gloriously over cover for four
great batting, this! Anderson bowled it a little too straight, so Sarwan flicks his wrists and gets four more
smashed to point for a single
short, Chanderpaul pulls for two. Actually, they only get a single - Chanderpaul's a little slow out of the blocks these days
pulled down to fine-leg, Rashid slips and they get through for two. It's so slippery out there - it absolutely bucketed down earlier, if you're just joining us
steps outside leg and guides to third man
carved out past Sidebottom at backward point, and they get two
shorter delivery and pulls this into the gap at midwicket - again for two. Very good placement indeed. This pair are so experienced, they've been around forever and have showed such calm sense
a full toss on his legs and that's four, and undoubtedly the match! Clips it quite square and Rashid, very fine at fine-leg, hasn't a hope. West Indies have one foot in the semis!
on his legs and he steals the strike with a single to a deep mid-on
full toss, banged through midwicket to Morgan, the substitute fielder for Rashid
smashed over extra cover and West Indies are into the semi-finals!
